item.title: 比特币将迎来自 2022 年加密货币崩溃以来最糟糕的一个月
item.description: 比特币有望创下自 2022 年一连串企业倒闭事件震撼整个加密货币行业以来的最差月度表现。【原文：Bitcoin is on track for its worst monthly performance since a string of corporate collapses rocked the wider crypto sector in 2022.】

item.title: 育碧推迟发布财报是在销售重述和贷款违约之后
item.description: 刺客信条》背后的视频游戏发行商育碧娱乐公司（Ubisoft Entertainment SA）称，审计师的审查迫使其重报 2025 财年的账目，并且不确认最近一个季度签订的一项合作协议的收入，这使其违反了贷款协议的条款。【原文：Ubisoft Entertainment SA, the video-game publisher behind Assassin’s Creed, said an auditor’s review forced it to restate its 2025 fiscal year accounts and to not recognize revenue from a partnership signed in its most recent quarter, putting it in violation of the terms of a loan agreement.】

item.title: 德意志银行旗下的 DWS 在转变中裁减亚洲私人信贷团队
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的资产管理部门 DWS 集团已解散其亚太区私人信贷团队，将该地区从其全球私人信贷战略中剔除。【原文：DWS Group, an asset management arm of Deutsche Bank AG, has dismissed its Asia Pacific private credit team as it removes the region from its global private credit strategy, according to people familiar of the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街逆转后欧洲股市将下跌
item.description: 本周风险偏好情绪升温，市场担忧科技股估值过高和美国货币政策走向不明，欧洲股市将延续跌势。【原文：European stocks were set to extend declines in a risk-off week marked by concerns about elevated technology valuations and an uncertain monetary policy path in the US.】

item.title: 受乌克兰和平计划和天气影响，欧洲天然气价格跌至 2024 年以来最低点
item.description: 在乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）同意制定一项和平计划，以及较温和的天气预报影响供暖需求前景之后，欧洲天然气期货跌至 2024 年 5 月以来的最低点。【原文：European natural gas futures dropped to the lowest since May 2024 after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy agreed to work on a peace plan and milder weather forecasts weighed on prospects for heating demand.】

item.title: 英国能源账单将因政策成本上升而略有上涨
item.description: 英国 1 月份的能源账单将略有上涨，即使能源批发价格下降，政府政策成本仍使账单居高不下。【原文：UK energy bills will rise slightly in January, with the cost of government policy continuing to keep bills high even as wholesale energy prices fall.】

item.title: 英国零售销售额在里夫斯预算案公布前大幅下降
item.description: 官方数据显示，由于消费者在节日和工党政府 11 月 26 日的预算案出台前退缩，英国 10 月份的零售销售额降幅远超预期。【原文：UK retail sales fell far more than expected in October, according to official data, as consumers retreated ahead of the festive season and the Labour government’s budget on Nov. 26.】

item.title: 据称长江和记将考虑收购零售商屈臣氏
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，长江和记黄埔控股有限公司正在考虑将保健及美容产品零售商屈臣氏集团上市。【原文：CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. is considering listing health and beauty retailer A.S. Watson Group, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 英国预算案前借款超支增至 99 亿英镑
item.description: 在英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）准备其 "不成功便成仁 "的预算案之际，英国今年的借贷仍将比预期多出数十亿美元，这凸显了公共财政的危险状况。【原文：Britain remains on course to borrow billions more than forecast this year, underscoring the perilous state of the public finances as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves prepares her make-or-break budget.】

item.title: CATL 力争在 12 月初重启中国主要锂矿
item.description: 由当代安佰利科技有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.当代安佰利科技股份有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.【原文：A key Chinese lithium mine run by Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is preparing to reopen as soon as early next month.】

item.title: 人工智能再陷低迷，股市注定下跌
中国开始耗资 14 亿美元改造毛泽东时代的非洲铁路
item.description: 赞比亚耗资 14 亿美元对连接南部非洲国家铜矿地区和印度洋港口的一条重要铁路进行了大修，中国总理在仪式上对该国进行了近三十年来的首次访问。【原文：Zambia initiated a $1.4 billion overhaul of a key railway linking the southern African nation’s copper region to a port on the Indian Ocean, in a ceremony that marked the first visit by a Chinese premier to the country in almost three decades.】

item.title: 沙索首席执行官认为化工业务有可能在 2028 年上市
item.description: 沙索有限公司（Sasol Ltd.首席执行官西蒙-巴洛伊（Simon Baloyi）说，这家南非公司可能最快于 2028 年分拆其国际化学品业务，这取决于利润增长的速度。【原文：Sasol Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Simon Baloyi said the South African company may spin off its international chemicals business as soon as 2028, depending on how quickly profit grows.】

item.title: 日本高市拒绝中国收回台湾言论的要求
item.description: 日本首相高市真奈回绝了中国提出的收回她最近对台湾的评论的要求，称东京将如何应对重大地区安全危机的立场没有改变。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi rebuffed demands from China to retract her recent comments about Taiwan, saying there was no change to Tokyo’s stance on how it would respond to a major regional security crisis.】

item.title: 开发商金茂计划发行债券，中国房地产债务面临考验
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，国家支持的开发商中国金茂控股集团有限公司（China Jinmao Holdings Group Ltd.）正计划三年多来首次发行海外债券，这将是对投资者是否愿意重新涉足这个受多年危机影响的行业的最新考验。【原文：State-backed developer China Jinmao Holdings Group Ltd. is planning its first overseas bond in more than three years, people familiar with the matter said, in what would be the latest test of investor willingness to wade back into a sector stung by years of crisis.】

item.title: 美国制裁俄罗斯石油会颠覆全球市场吗？
item.description: 10 月 22 日，美国政府宣布对俄罗斯最大的两个原油生产国实施制裁，能源市场为之一震。制裁措施于 11 月 21 日生效后，全球石油供应和价格将如何反应，现在成为各方关注的焦点。【原文：The US government jolted energy markets when it announced sanctions on Russia’s two biggest crude oil producers on Oct. 22. All eyes are now on how global oil supply and prices will react after the measures took effect on Nov. 21.】

item.title: 南非债券将因通胀前景而延续涨势
item.description: 在南非央行下调基准利率并表示随着通胀放缓将进一步下调利率之后，南非债券仍有空间延续本半年度新兴市场的最佳涨势。【原文：South African bonds have room to extend this half’s best emerging-market rally after the country’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate and signaled further reductions are in store as inflation moderates.】

item.title: 佐科维说：如果领导人为工人做好准备，人工智能就能创造就业机会
item.description: 印度尼西亚前总统佐科-维多多（Joko Widodo）说，未来 "智能经济 "的前景将取决于对民众进行人工智能培训，以及对世界银行和世界贸易组织等全球机构的系统进行重新思考。【原文：Former Indonesian President Joko Widodo said the promise of a coming “intelligent economy” will hinge on training populations in artificial intelligence and rethinking the systems of global institutions such as the World Bank and the World Trade Organization.】

item.title: 英国预算案让蕾切尔-里夫斯面临 300 亿英镑的清算
item.description: 当基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）的办公室得知有人阴谋推翻他的首相职位时，他的大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）正沉浸在一个难得的好消息中。【原文：When Keir Starmer’s office caught wind of a plot to oust him as prime minister, his Chancellor Rachel Reeves was basking in a rare bit of good news.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官否认对新员工引入台积电技术的担忧
item.description: 英特尔公司英特尔公司首席执行官陈立武驳斥了有关一名新员工从台湾半导体制造股份有限公司窃取商业机密的报道，称这家美国芯片制造商尊重其他公司的知识产权。【原文：Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan dismissed reports about a new hire taking trade secrets from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. to his company, saying the US chipmaker respects other firms’ intellectual property.】

item.title: 日本最大核电站将获得事实上的重启批准
item.description: 据彭博社看到的文件显示，东京电力公司将于周五获得日本地方长官的批准，重启该国最大的核电站。【原文：Tokyo Electric Power Co. will receive approval from a local Japanese governor on Friday to restart the country’s biggest nuclear power plant, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 印度 11 月经济活动放缓，最新采购经理人指数显示
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）的一项即时调查显示，由于美国的高额关税继续对这个南亚国家造成压力，印度11月份的经济活动放缓，拖累了就业岗位的创造。【原文：India’s economic activity slowed in November, weighing on job creation, a flash survey by HSBC Holdings Plc showed, as the US’s steep tariffs continued to pinch the South Asian nation.】

item.title: 需求疲软和林吉特走强导致棕榈油跌幅扩大
item.description: 由于马来西亚出口减少和林吉特走强，棕榈油连续第二个交易日下跌。【原文：Palm oil fell for a second session due to waning exports from Malaysia and a stronger ringgit.】

item.title: 可生物降解塑料制品的肮脏秘密
item.description:
越来越多的国家禁止使用添加剂制造塑料，制造商称添加剂可使塑料分解。【原文：

More countries are banning plastics made with additives that manufacturers say can make them decompose.

】

item.title: 欧尔班正在为危机做准备，投资者不解其中缘由
item.description: 匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）为金融市场崩溃所做的准备令投资者感到困惑，因为他们几乎看不到世界上表现最好的新兴市场之一即将崩溃的迹象。【原文：Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s preparations for a financial-market meltdown are baffling investors who see little signs of a looming collapse in one of the world’s best-performing emerging markets.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克电力公司扭亏为盈后计划发行更多债券
item.description: 斯洛伐克占主导地位的电力公司计划出售更多债券，这是该公司 14 年来首次在债务市场上发行绿色债券。【原文：Slovakia’s dominant power utility plans to sell more bonds after tapping the debt market for the first time in 14 years with a debut green issue.】

item.title: 埃尔德森将延长欧洲央行监督部门副主席任期
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员弗兰克-埃尔德森（Frank Elderson）准备延长其作为该机构监管部门副主席的任期。【原文：European Central Bank Executive Board member Frank Elderson is ready to extend his tenure as vice chair of the institution’s supervisory arm, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 俄罗斯人利用新的支付工具适应没有 SWIFT 的生活
item.description: 娜塔莉亚是一名在德国做生意的顾问，她要把钱转出俄罗斯，需要绕道而行。【原文：To transfer money out of Russia, Natalia, a consultant with a business in Germany, takes a roundabout route.】

item.title: 人工智能担忧蔓延，新兴市场股市将迎来四月以来最差一周
item.description: 由于对人工智能行业估值过高的担忧影响了该地区的科技股市场，亚洲新兴股市暴跌，创下 4 月份以来的最差一周。【原文：Emerging-Asian equities tumbled, heading for their worst week since April, as concerns over stretched valuations in the artificial intelligence sector weighed on the region’s tech-heavy markets.】

item.title: 台湾保险公司通过会计变更寻求 29 亿美元减免
item.description: 据一个行业组织发表的声明称，台湾的人寿保险公司提议修改会计规则，这将使每年的对冲成本减少 900 亿新台币（约合 29 亿美元），并为过度的货币波动提供救济。【原文：Taiwan’s life insurers proposed changes to accounting rules that will cut annual hedging costs by NT$90 billion ($2.9 billion) and provide relief for excessive currency swings, according to a statement from an industry group.】
